subject: Business
title: Scarcity: Why Limited Editions Sell
description: A 60-second lesson on Scarcity: Why Limited Editions Sell.

hook.text: Supreme drops 50 T-shirts. They sell out in 8 seconds. The same shirt without the limit would sit on racks.

buildup.text: Scarcity makes things more desirable. When something is rare, we assume it must be valuable.

discovery.text: Psychologists showed people rate identical cookies as tastier when there are fewer in the jar.

twist.text: Manufactured scarcity â€” fake countdown timers, artificial limits â€” works but erodes trust when exposed.

climax.text: Real scarcity (limited materials, seasonal availability) is more sustainable and more ethical.

punchline.text: We want what we might lose more than what we can easily get.

quiz.question: Why does scarcity increase perceived value?
options: People assume rare things must be more valuable
Scarce items are always higher quality
Limited items cost more to produce
